sentences.en: A general ranks a captain.
sentences.cn: 上将的级别高于上尉。

sentences.en: Colonel is the military rank between lieutenant - colonel and brigadier.
sentences.cn: 上校是陆军中校之上、准将之下的军衔.

sentences.en: Dense smoke swirled and billowed, its rank fumes choking her.
sentences.cn: 滚滚浓烟盘旋翻腾，恶臭味呛得她喘不过气来。

sentences.en: Everyone lines up in ranks, all facing the instructor.
sentences.cn: 大家都一排排站好，面朝教练。

sentences.en: He was demoted to the rank of ordinary soldier.
sentences.cn: 他被降为普通一兵.

sentences.en: He was sentenced to prison and stripped of his rank (= had his rank taken from him ) .
sentences.cn: 他被判入狱，并且被剥夺了军衔。

sentences.en: He wore shoulderstrap rank slides with sergeant's chevrons.
sentences.cn: 他佩戴标示级别的肩章，上面有中士的V形标志。

sentences.en: It is not always easy to rank the students in order of ability.
sentences.cn: 把学生按能力排名并非总是容易的。

sentences.en: Never imagine that rank confers genuine authority.
sentences.cn: 绝对不要幻想那个头衔会有实权。

sentences.en: people of all ranks in society
sentences.cn: 社会各阶层的人

sentences.en: Rank was contractually obliged to hand him a cheque for $30 million.
sentences.cn: 根据合约，兰克应当交付给他一张3,000万美元的支票。

sentences.en: She refused to promote Colin above the low rank of "legal adviser".
sentences.cn: 她拒绝把科林由“法律顾问”这一低级别往上提。

sentences.en: She was lifted from a captain to the rank of major.
sentences.cn: 她从上尉提升为少校.

sentences.en: Substantial numbers of rank and file members ignored their union's advice.
sentences.cn: 有相当一部分普通员工不理睬工会的建议。

sentences.en: The Captain pulled rank and made his sergeant row the entire way.
sentences.cn: 上校倚仗权势让他的中士划船划了一路。

sentences.en: The captain was promoted to the rank of major.
sentences.cn: 那上尉被提升为少校.

sentences.en: The kitchen was rank with the smell of drying uniforms.
sentences.cn: 厨房内充斥着烘干制服的难闻气味。

sentences.en: The man led the way to the taxi rank.
sentences.cn: 那人带路来到了出租汽车候客处。

sentences.en: The payment offered to the rank and file is extremely poor.
sentences.cn: 列兵的待遇极低.

sentences.en: the rank and file of the workforce
sentences.cn: 普通劳动者

sentences.en: There were several pairs of riding boots ranked neatly in the hall.
sentences.cn: 门厅里整齐地摆放着几双马靴。

sentences.en: We rank among the safest countries in the world.
sentences.cn: 我们是世界上最安全的国家之一。

words.tran_cn: 出身行伍的军官；士兵；对某事胆怯或临阵脱逃的人

phrases.tran_cn: （军警）解散队列；打乱队形；溃散
n. 前列；最重要；最突出；最好
弄权：利用某人的高级职位谋求利益
n. 民众，老百姓；普通士兵，普通成员

trans.tran_en: if something is rank, it has a very strong unpleasant smell

trans.tran_cn: 地位，级别，军衔，普通士兵，等级，成员，队列
trans.tran_en: the position or level that someone holds in an organization, especially in the police or the army, navy etc
to arrange objects in a line or row
to arrange objects in a line or row
to have a particular position in a list of people or things that have been put in order of quality or importance
